alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 22 at 8:53PM MDT until April 24 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MDT SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Northerly wind frequently gusting 45 to 55 mph, and as high as 65 to 75 mph over the north end of the county. The strongest wind and heaviest snow will occur across northern Johnson County. * WHERE...Johnson County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to midnight Saturday night. The worst conditions are expected between 3 AM and 3 PM Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be severely impacted by the combination of snow and wind. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility to whiteout conditions, including along I- 90 and I-25.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
